clinical_study.official_title: Impact of SARS-CoV-2 Infection on the Incidence of ICU Acquired Colonization Related to Multidrug-resistant Bacteria

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter before-after study aimed to determine the impact of infection related to SARS-CoV-2 on the incidence of ICU-acquired multidrug resistant (MDR) bacteria.

detailed_description.textblock: Multicenter observational before-after study, aiming to determine the impact of infection related to SARS-CoV-2 on the incidence of ICU-acquired colonization and infection related to MDR bacteria.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of ICU-acquired colonization related multidrug resistant bacteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: from D3 until day 28 after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: percentage of patients with ICU acquired MDR bacteria colonization

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of ICU-acquired infection related to multidrug resistant bacteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from D3 until day 28 after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: percentage of patients with ICU acquired MDR bacteria infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from D1 until day 28 after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: the number of days Under mechanical ventilation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from D1 until day 28 after ICU admission

secondary_outcome.measure: length of stay in intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from D1 until day 28 after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: the number of days of hospitalization in the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Expected ICU stay > 48 hours
- Rectal and nasal BMR screening performed < 48 hours after admission to ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged < 18 years Refusal to take part in the study ICU-stay < 48 hours At least a second rectal and nasal BMR screening was not performed prior to ICU discharge (a posteriori exclusion criterion).
